de.awi.floenavigation.helperclasses

Class DialogActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity
            • de.awi.floenavigation.helperclasses.DialogActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback

    public class DialogActivity
extends android.app.Activity
    This Activity creates and displays different type of Dialogs according to the parameters passed to it in its calling Intent. Currently it displays four different type of Dialogs

    The Validation Dialog is created when the ValidationService fails for a Fixed Station and the Dialog Box contains a simple message and can be canceled by a simple Tap on the screen. When the Dialog is canceled it starts the MainActivity.

    The About Us Dialog is created from the MainActivity and contains info about the App. The Dialog Box contains the info in simple text and the Dialog Box can be canceled by a Simple tap on the screen which returns the App to MainActivity.

    The Tablet ID dialog is created only once when the App is used for the first time. It is created when the AdminPageActivity is started. It contains a simple message with an EditText in which the Tablet ID is entered and an Okay button. On clicking the Okay button the text (Tablet ID) in the EditText is inserted in the Database and it returns to AdminPageActivity.

    The Setup Complete Dialog is created when the Next button is clicked in SetupActivity at the end of the Predictions. The Dialog Box contains a text message with two Buttons (Confirm and Finish). On clicking Confirm the SetupActivity is restarted to re-run the Predictions. On clicking Finish MainActivity is started and the last calculated Grid Parameters are inserted in the Database.

    See Also:
    MainActivity, SetupActivity, ValidationService, AdminPageActivity

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  DialogActivity.InsertBetaOnStartup
      An AsyncTask to insert the beta value passed to it (receivedBeta) in the Database table DatabaseHelper.betaTable.
      private class  DialogActivity.SetupTabletID
      An AsyncTask to insert the tablet ID entered in the Database table DatabaseHelper.configParametersTable.

      • receivedBeta

        private double receivedBeta
        The value of the angle DatabaseHelper.beta to insert in the Database table DatabaseHelper.betaTable on the completion of SetupActivity. This is used if the current Dialog is the Dialog box shown at the end of the predictions in SetupActivity.
        See Also:
        SetupActivity

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Default Activity.onCreate(Bundle). Registers the broadcastReceiver and retrieves the values for type of dialog box to display from the Intent with which this activity was started. Then depending on the type of Dialog Box to display it will create and display the Dialog Box.
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class android.app.Activity
        Parameters:

                                android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)
        Inserts the Beta value passed to it in the Database table DatabaseHelper.betaTable.
        Parameters:
        recdBeta - the value of the angle DatabaseHelper.beta to insert in the Database.
        db - An instance of the local Database
        Returns:
        true if the value is inserted successfully.
